summary:
Ebony set with winged full plate helmet (mesh swap).
A warm golden gleam (cubemap) and a metallic glint (specular maps).
descriptionHtml:
MOD Name: 	Paladin\'s Panoply

TYPE:		Texture/Mesh Replacement (Ebony + Nordplate Helmet)

RESOLUTION:	Standard - but in DXT5 and with custom specular maps in 1024 & 512 + Cubemap.

NOTES:
Helmet mesh swapped with the winged full plate helmet - so you can still use the ebony helmet and get the \"Matching Set\" bonus.
The helmet does not use the custom Ebony Cubemap (waiting for kit) so it doesn\'t receive the intended golden gleam (yet!).
All in all I think the set brings out a lot of detail, for standard resolution textures.
Shiny when lighting permits, but not so blinding as to cancel out the details.
Exhibits both a warm golden gleam and a metallic glint
Screenshots are without AA and with low shadows, it\'ll look better for you, no doubt  -  bastards! :D
Lastly, as the name implies, male only. Well the cuirass anyway.


INSTALLATION:
Drop \"Meshes\" and \"Textures\" in \"..\\The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim\\Data\\\"

UNINSTALL:
Pickup what you dropped and put it in the bin.


Enjoy
Daniel


CREDITS:
WhoAteTheRamen : Chain samples & inspiration.
Wafiks : Cubemap template.


Additional note:
A complimentary \"Sword&Shield\" Sound Mod is in the works and may or may not be released (waiting for kit).
But if anyone tires of running around in loafers and slapping pseudo-metallic sticks at critters - before that - I guess you could yell really really loud and I might hear you ...and release sort of a quick-fix alpha!

Helmet Update: (v1.05)
Alternative textures for the Ebony Helmet.
Don\'t use the NIF files from the Main Mod if you prefer the Ebony Helmet.
Credits & Permissions Exception.
The Helmet does not contain bytes from others and you are exempted from all restrictions (including crediting me).
Hack-slash-burn-distribute as you please.
author: Duns Inc
